conditions.name: Admission Reschedule Condition
conditions.description: Condition for rescheduling admission to the Clinical Research Unit (CRU).
conditions.text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Insulin Infusion Stop Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria to stop the insulin infusion used to induce hypoglycemia.
conditions.text: Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review Trigger
conditions.description: Condition for conducting an interim safety review.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2 and complete Period 2 Day 1.

conditions.name: Continuation after Safety Review
conditions.description: Condition for dosing the remaining patients after the interim safety review.
conditions.text: If no clinically significant safety findings for treatment or study procedure are noted, the remaining patients will be dosed.

conditions.name: TE ADA Additional Follow-up Trigger
conditions.description: Condition for initiating additional follow-up for immunogenicity.
conditions.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

conditions.name: TE ADA Additional Follow-up Stop Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for stopping the additional follow-up for immunogenicity.
conditions.text: Additional follow-up continues until the titer returns to baseline (ie, returns to within a single 2-fold dilution of the baseline titer) or until 1 year after the last dose of study treatment.

conditions.name: Patient Replacement Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for replacing a patient who has discontinued.
conditions.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

transitionRules.name: Continuation of Enrollment Post-Safety Review
transitionRules.text: If no clinically significant safety findings are noted after the first 6 patients complete Period 2, the remaining patients will be dosed.

transitionRules.name: Handling of Inadvertently Enrolled Patients
transitionRules.text: If the sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria, a discussion must occur to determine if the patient may continue in the study. Documented approval from the Lilly CP/CRP is required to allow the patient to continue.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Enrollment in Another Clinical Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient will be discontinued for enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or other incompatible medical research.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Medical, Safety, or Regulatory Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient will be discontinued if participation needs to be stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and good clinical practice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Patient Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Discontinuation for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1, the study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Completion of all protocol-required visits, including the final follow-up visit.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Interim Safety Review Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.timepointId: After first 6 patients complete Period 2 Day 1
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to continue dosing remaining patients or stop the study based on safety data from the first 6 patients.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Admission Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to proceed with or reschedule admission based on patient's plasma glucose level.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Additional Follow-up Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to place a patient into an additional follow-up period based on the presence of treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies.
